page.title: 08Gentleman's Row
page.content:
Gentleman's Row is famous for its collection of old houses. These houses date back to Victorian times. There is a wide road separating the houses from their gardens. This allowed coaches to drop their occupants outside their houses.
One of the houses contains part of {Enfield Palace}which stood where Pearson's store stands today. This house contains some of the dark oak panelling and chimney piece.
The most famous inhabitant of Gentleman's Row was{Charles Lamb}Both he and his sister Mary frequently visited a friend in Enfield and stayed at Elm House. Charles Lamb then took up residence at Clarendon Cottage. The whole of Gentleman's row still stands today.
